Class StoreFront

java.lang.Object
com.gamestore.model.StoreFront
public class StoreFront extends Object
Represents the main interface for the game merchandise store. Manages store inventory, shopping cart, and user interaction logic. Provides methods for browsing products, making purchases, and checkout.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    StoreFront()
    Default constructor initializes inventory, cart, and store name.

  • Constructor Details

    • StoreFront

      public StoreFront()
      Default constructor initializes inventory, cart, and store name. Creates a new InventoryManager and ShoppingCart instance.

  • Method Details

    • getStoreName

      public String getStoreName()
      Returns the name of the store.
      Returns:
      the store name as a String

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the store's inventory from file. If no products are loaded, sample products are added and saved. This method is called when the store is first started.

    • displayProducts

      public void displayProducts()
      Displays all available products in the inventory. Prints each product's details to the console.

    • getProductSelectionFromUser

      public String getProductSelectionFromUser(Scanner scanner)
      Displays numbered product list and prompts user to select by number. This prevents name-typing errors and improves user experience.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The Scanner object to read user input
      Returns:
      The selected product name or null if the selection is invalid

    • purchaseProduct

      public void purchaseProduct(String productName, int quantity)
      Attempts to purchase a product by name and quantity. Validates product availability and adds item to cart if valid.
      Parameters:
      productName - the name of the product to purchase
      quantity - the quantity to purchase

    • cancelPurchase

      public void cancelPurchase(String productName)
      Removes a product from the shopping cart completely. Returns all units of the product to inventory.
      Parameters:
      productName - The name of the product to remove

    • cancelPartialPurchase

      public boolean cancelPartialPurchase(String productName, int quantity)
      Removes a specific quantity of a product from the shopping cart. Allows partial cancellation of a purchase, rather than removing all units. Returns the specified quantity back to inventory.
      Parameters:
      productName - The name of the product to remove
      quantity - The quantity to remove
      Returns:
      true if successful, false if the product wasn't found or quantity was invalid

    • displayCart

      public void displayCart()
      Displays the contents of the shopping cart in numbered format. Uses consistent user-friendly display style.

    • checkout

      public void checkout()
      Processes the checkout and clears the cart. Displays summary and confirmation. In a real system, this would handle payment processing.

    • getInventory

      public InventoryManager getInventory()
      Gets the inventory manager.
      Returns:
      The inventory manager instance

    • getCart

      public ShoppingCart getCart()
      Gets the shopping cart.
      Returns:
      The shopping cart instance
